intro: Forsteronia propinqua, commonly known as the dwarf forsteria, is a small, evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and coastal climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in harsh environments.
